item.title: Paying 65K RS2gp if someone can do this pre-algebra
item.dc:creator: @d3ltr33 d3ltr33
item.description:
@d3ltr33 wrote:

afi:

[quote author=d3ltr33 link=topic=787.msg7810#msg7810 date=1143719026]
What year are you in dude? And what level maths are you doing?

im in 8th and its pre-algebra or should i say pre-algebro[br][size=1]Posted at: March 30, 2006, 07:03:54 am[/size][hr]what if it something like this
8-x=2s- 1 or 2n-5=8n+10-3

i dont understand all of this :([/quote]

The trick with those is to get all the "unknowns" on one side or the =, and all the constants or "knowns" on the other side....

2n-5=8n+10-3

  1. 10-3 is 7. So rewrite.
    2n-5=8n+7

  2. We want all the unknowns on one side... so we subtract 2n from both sides. (You do know that you can do anything to an equation aslong as you do the same to both sides... so if i had 10x = 80... i divide both sides by 10 and i get x=8).
    Subtracting 2n from both side gives us, -5=6n+7

  3. Then subtract 7 from both sides. (Since we want knowns and unknowns to be on either side of = sign)
    -12=6n

  4. Divide both sides by 6
    -2=n

Answer is n = -2

Read full topic

item.title: Paying 65K RS2gp if someone can do this pre-algebra
item.dc:creator: @daiki daiki
item.description:
@daiki wrote:

Wow.. multiple choice :). Yea, I know jme told the same thing.

Okay. Just think it like this:
In the first one, 5x - 2x = 12, you see that "5 times x" minus "2 times x" equals 12.
They are both the same type, x. Same types of number can be counted with other ones of the same type.
This means that "5x - 2x = 3x" which is 12.
3x = 12. If 3 times x is 12, then one times x is three times less than 12. x = 12 / 3.
You will get that x = 4. Easy?

The next one is the same.
3x + 7x = 20.
__/
|
10x = 20.

x = 20/10.
x = 2.

Third one is more complicated. Now there is type x and a number. x and number will not mix.
So, if 2x + 2 = 5 then 2x = 5 - 2. The numbers have to be "moved" to the same side where other numbers are. When the number is positive it will be negative on the other side.
Why is this?
Here's an example. If 2 - 2 = 0 then 2 = 2. See? You can swap the places, easy.

So, back to the point.
2x = 5 - 2
2x = 3
x = 3/2
x = 1.5

The other ones are quite the same. But let's take the question 18 for a check.
18: 13x = 20 + 12.5

Quite easy, just sum up 20 and 12.5 and you'll get
13 x = 32.5
x = 32.5 / 13
x = 2.5

Read full topic
item.source: Paying 65K RS2gp if someone can do this pre-algebra

item.title: Paying 65K RS2gp if someone can do this pre-algebra
item.dc:creator: @inferno inferno
item.description:
@inferno wrote:

Easy

Okay, lets take number one as an example:

5x - 2x = 12

Hmmm... 5x - 2x so thats the equivilent of 3x yes? Now you divide 12 by 3 and your answer is equal to x.

Now lets take number 8:

6x + 4 = 34

First of all minus 4 from 34 leaving you with 30. Now simply divide 30 by 6 giving you your answer.

Finally lets choose number 20:

7u - 8u = 13

7u minus 8u gives you -1u which is equal to 13 so obviously 1u will be equal to -13.

I think now you can work out the other questions and how they work based on these

Read full topic

item.title: Paying 65K RS2gp if someone can do this pre-algebra
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I'll take a look.

edit*

Easy

I havn't read them all, but this'll be good practice for me. I try to do them(Free).

Do you need the work to be shown?

Btw, your gonna need to learn this stuff at some point or another. This stuff is especially easy since it's multiple choice.

1.) 4
2.) 2
3.) 1.5
4.) -7 (note, it's negative)
5.) -4
6.) 8
7.) 9.5
8.) 5
9.) -5
10.) 9
11.) -14
12.) -19
13.) 6
14.) 240
15.) -11
16.) 12.5
17.) 1/2
18.) 2.5
19.) 12
20.) -13
If I had the time, I;d honestly show you how to get each ne, but I am terrible at explaining things. Btw, I did the majority of these all in my head, so once you learn you shouldnt have too much trouble.

Read full topic
